column4: I need some help guys, apparently photobucket.com was hacked today, and if you visited the site you saw a message from the hackers. Well, I thought it was no big deal, but the site also infected everyone with a redirect virus. Now every site I go to, once I click on a link, it redirects to the same site. I am an ubuntu user, that's why I'm asking here. How can I fix this?
Or you can see the http headers that are being passed aroud and paste it somewhere for us
whats the easiest way to do that?
Hold on.
thanks and ok
Download LiveHTTP Headers for Firefox using this command and then open the downloaded file in Firefox:
wget https://addons.mozilla.org/en-US/firefox/downloads/file/28118/live_http_headers-0.14-fx+sm.xpi
ok, just a sec
That will ask you to install the addon.  If that doesn't work, you might want to drag and drop that file into the addons manager.
Also, are all your browsers affected?
yes, FF &Opera
sudo aptitude install midori.  THat browser even if it is alpha quality, should work for a while.  Even epiphany-browser (and elinks if you can use the console).
Have you also tried rm -rf ~/.opera
i wget the link, where is the file saved?
type 'pwd'  that's where.
sweet, ok, just a sec
what kind of file is .xpi?
Type   `file filename.xpi` and see for yourself.
Which version of firefox are you using?
ok, live http headers is installed, whats next
where are you buddy?
